question_content.barrons:question: The shop’s (i) ___________ prices ensured that its clientele came from only the most (ii) ________ households.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
exorbitant; affluent.

Exorbitant (excessive; overly expensive) prices would guarantee or make certain that the shop’s customers would have to come from affluent (wealthy) households.

Pragmatic is incorrect. Pragmatic means practical. It is an inappropriate term to describe prices.

Salutary is incorrect. Salutary means healthful or wholesome. It is an inappropriate term to describe prices.

Prolific is incorrect. Prolific means highly fruitful or productive, as in a prolific rose bush or a prolific novelist. It makes little sense in the context.

Destitute is incorrect. Destitute means needy or impoverished. It makes little sense in the context.
